pr_title: Fix deprecation warnings + Update ArtifactArchiver to no longer consult with environment variables injected by EnvironmentContributingActions during the build

timeline.bodyText: Pretty sure this is wrong given what it does.
timeline.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText: Yes, you are right. It is a little confusing to mark something as deprecated to warn others not to use it.
replies.author: StefanSpieker

timeline.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText: You are right. Thanks also. Reverted.
replies.author: StefanSpieker

timeline.author: daniel-beck

timeline.bodyText: This might slightly change the behavior. Missing argument will force environment variable recalculation in https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/blob/master/core/src/main/java/jenkins/tasks/SimpleBuildStep.java#L91 . Instead of that, current code will use the environment passed in the beginning of the step. In the edge case build.pickArtifactManager().archive might perform some environment-contributing actions, which will no longer be considered after the change.
timeline.author: oleg-nenashev

replies.bodyText:
@oleg-nenashev Yeah, I would agree. IIUC since ArtifactManager can be supplied by external storage plugins, it would be ideal to recalculate the environment.
f.perform(build, ws, run.getEnvironment(listener), launcher, listener);
replies.author: stellargo

replies.bodyText: No, do not do that! The currently proposed patch is correct.
replies.author: jglick
